segment.source: Add a custom tool to the Windows RE boot options menu
segment.target: Add a custom tool to the Windows RE boot options menu

segment.source: Add a custom tool to the Windows RE boot options menu
segment.target: Add a custom tool to the Windows RE boot options menu

segment.source: Add a custom tool to the Windows RE boot options menu
segment.target: Add a custom tool to the Windows RE boot options menu

segment.source: You can add a custom troubleshooting or diagnostic tool to the Windows Recovery Environment (WinRE) image.
segment.target: You can add a custom troubleshooting or diagnostic tool to the Windows Recovery Environment (WinRE) image.

segment.source: This tool is displayed in the Boot Options menu.
segment.target: This tool is displayed in the Boot Options menu.

segment.source: By developing your custom tool to run in WinRE, you can leverage the touch and on-screen keyboard support available in WinRE.
segment.target: By developing your custom tool to run in WinRE, you can leverage the touch and on-screen keyboard support available in WinRE.

segment.source: New for Windows 10: You won't be able to add WinRE optional components that aren't already in the default WinRE tools.
segment.target: New for Windows 10: You won't be able to add WinRE optional components that aren't already in the default WinRE tools.

segment.source: For example, if you have a app from Windows 8 that depended on the .NET optional components, you'll need to rewrite the app for Windows 10.
segment.target: For example, if you have a app from Windows 8 that depended on the .NET optional components, you'll need to rewrite the app for Windows 10.

segment.source: To add a custom tool
segment.target: To add a custom tool

segment.source: Extract and mount a Windows image (install.wim) and its corresponding WinRE image (winre.wim):
segment.target: Extract and mount a Windows image (install.wim) and its corresponding WinRE image (winre.wim):

segment.source: For more information about these steps, see the topic: Customize Windows RE.
segment.target: For more information about these steps, see the topic: Customize Windows RE.

segment.source: In Notepad, create a configuration file that specifies the custom tool’s filename and parameters (if any):
segment.target: In Notepad, create a configuration file that specifies the custom tool’s filename and parameters (if any):

segment.source: Where C:ToolsOEMDiagnostics.exe is the custom troubleshooting or diagnostics tool, and where /param1 and /param2 are optional parameters used when running this custom tool.
segment.target: Where C:ToolsOEMDiagnostics.exe is the custom troubleshooting or diagnostics tool, and where /param1 and /param2 are optional parameters used when running this custom tool.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: You can only add one custom tool to the WinRE boot options menus.
segment.target: You can only add one custom tool to the WinRE boot options menus.

segment.source: Save the file using UTF-8 coding.
segment.target: Save the file using UTF-8 coding.

segment.source: Do not use ANSI:
segment.target: Do not use ANSI:

segment.source: Click File, and then click Save As.
segment.target: Click File, and then click Save As.

segment.source: In the Encoding box, select UTF-8, and save this file as .
segment.target: In the Encoding box, select UTF-8, and save this file as .

segment.source: Create a SourcesRecoveryTools folder in the WinRE mount folder, and then copy the custom tool and its configuration file into the new folder:
segment.target: Create a SourcesRecoveryTools folder in the WinRE mount folder, and then copy the custom tool and its configuration file into the new folder:

segment.source: The custom tool and any associated folders must be in this folder so that it can continue to work after future WinRE upgrades.
segment.target: The custom tool and any associated folders must be in this folder so that it can continue to work after future WinRE upgrades.

segment.source: Commit your customizations and unmount the WinRE image:
segment.target: Commit your customizations and unmount the WinRE image:

segment.source: Optional: make a backup copy of the WinRE image.
segment.target: Optional: make a backup copy of the WinRE image.

segment.source: You can often reuse the same customizations on multiple images.
segment.target: You can often reuse the same customizations on multiple images.

segment.source: Unmount and save the changes from the base Windows image:
segment.target: Unmount and save the changes from the base Windows image:

segment.source: To deploy the image
segment.target: To deploy the image

segment.source: In Notepad, create a configuration file that describes the custom tool in the boot options menu.
segment.target: In Notepad, create a configuration file that describes the custom tool in the boot options menu.

segment.source: Add descriptions for each language you support.
segment.target: Add descriptions for each language you support.

segment.source: This example specifies both English and French language versions of the tool name and description:
segment.target: This example specifies both English and French language versions of the tool name and description:

segment.source: Warning
segment.target: Warning

segment.source: Limit the and values to approximately 30 characters or less to make sure that they appear correctly in the boot options menu.
segment.target: Limit the and values to approximately 30 characters or less to make sure that they appear correctly in the boot options menu.

segment.source: Save the file using UTF-8 coding:
segment.target: Save the file using UTF-8 coding:

segment.source: Click File, and then click Save As.
segment.target: Click File, and then click Save As.

segment.source: In the Encoding box, select UTF-8, and save this file as .
segment.target: In the Encoding box, select UTF-8, and save this file as .

segment.source: Where E: is the drive letter of a removable drive or network location.
segment.target: Where E: is the drive letter of a removable drive or network location.

segment.source: On your destination computer, during image deployment, but after you register the custom WinRE boot image and the Windows operating system, you must register the description of the custom tool:
segment.target: On your destination computer, during image deployment, but after you register the custom WinRE boot image and the Windows operating system, you must register the description of the custom tool:

segment.source: If the custom tool is registered properly, the output from running this command will be: .
segment.target: If the custom tool is registered properly, the output from running this command will be: .

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: For more information about deploying Windows, see the Deploy Windows RE topic.
segment.target: For more information about deploying Windows, see the Deploy Windows RE topic.

segment.source: To verify the custom tool appears in the Boot Options menu when launched from Windows
segment.target: To verify the custom tool appears in the Boot Options menu when launched from Windows

segment.source: Restart the destination computer, and complete OOBE as your user.
segment.target: Restart the destination computer, and complete OOBE as your user.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If you are prompted for a product key, click Skip.
segment.target: If you are prompted for a product key, click Skip.

segment.source: Click StartPC settings, and then select General.
segment.target: Click StartPC settings, and then select General.

segment.source: In the Advanced startup section, select Restart now.
segment.target: In the Advanced startup section, select Restart now.

segment.source: The Windows Boot Options menu appears.
segment.target: The Windows Boot Options menu appears.

segment.source: In the Boot Options menu, select Troubleshoot, and then click the Fabrikam Utility link.
segment.target: In the Boot Options menu, select Troubleshoot, and then click the Fabrikam Utility link.

segment.source: The computer restarts in WinRE, and the tool that is specified in the RecoveryTools section of the WinREConfig.xml file, appears.
segment.target: The computer restarts in WinRE, and the tool that is specified in the RecoveryTools section of the WinREConfig.xml file, appears.

segment.source: Confirm that the custom tool works properly, and then close the tool.
segment.target: Confirm that the custom tool works properly, and then close the tool.

segment.source: If the custom tool does not appear on the Boot Options menu, you can try the following:
segment.target: If the custom tool does not appear on the Boot Options menu, you can try the following:

segment.source: Verify the WinREConfig.xml and the AddDiagnosticsToolToBootMenu.xml files are saved using the UTF-8 encoding format.
segment.target: Verify the WinREConfig.xml and the AddDiagnosticsToolToBootMenu.xml files are saved using the UTF-8 encoding format.

segment.source: Disable WinRE, register the custom tool again, and then enable WinRE.
segment.target: Disable WinRE, register the custom tool again, and then enable WinRE.

segment.source: For example:
segment.target: For example:

segment.source: To verify the custom tool appears in the WinRE recovery menu
segment.target: To verify the custom tool appears in the WinRE recovery menu

segment.source: In the recovery menu, select Troubleshoot, and then click the Fabrikam Utility link.
segment.target: In the recovery menu, select Troubleshoot, and then click the Fabrikam Utility link.

segment.source: Confirm that the custom tool works properly, and then close the tool.
segment.target: Confirm that the custom tool works properly, and then close the tool.

segment.source: Click Continue.
segment.target: Click Continue.

segment.source: The PC reboots into the operating system.
segment.target: The PC reboots into the operating system.
